Name: Mummy
Description: The finely preserved mummy of a falcon, lying in an extended position.The falcon is primarily associated with the god Horus, son of Osiris. The Horus-falcon was the guardian deity of the pharaoh and was frequently depicted with it's wings protectively outstretched behind the head of the king. By the Late Period there was a catacomb for mummified falcons at Saqqara, recent examination of these birds has revealed them to be several different types of birds of prey.
